website_summaries.verdict: For those who need precise and technical footwork when climbing, this shoe will give you excellent quality.
pros: Plenty of padding inside the shoe, especially around the tongue area, so you can wear it comfortably for an entire day
Uses straps across the top of the shoe to allow you to adjust the tightness of the fit
High quality of rubber sole to allow for edging
cons: Shoe sizes tend to run small
May not be of a high enough quality to justify the high price

customer_reviews.title: Great all around shoe
customer_reviews.text: Order street shoe size in these. Great all around shoe, edges well, smears well, may take some time to get used to the aggressive heel cup. Love the blue version, the orange is supposed to switch to the C4 rubber per 5.10, but hard to go wrong with either. The rubber needs some break in to fully appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie E

customer_reviews.title: ... had problems trying find shoes that fit snug but comfortably. The Anasazi VCS's shape fits my feet quite ...
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and had problems trying find shoes that fit snug but comfortably. The Anasazi VCS's shape fits my feet quite nicely, although the heel cup is a bit too large/long. These are my first pair of climbing shoes and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for anyone needing a solid shoe and wants to ...
customer_reviews.text: Tremendous fan of the Anasazi Verdes, but with those no longer being made these are about as close to the secure, no frills shoe, but there is a little less sensitivity owed I believe to thicker rubber. Recommend for anyone needing a solid shoe and wants to train the foot to pull in rather than rely on aggressive and cramped shoes. Fair warning on sizing, though, is the anasazi tag has cut into my ankle if improperly sized.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Laschober

customer_reviews.title: They work perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: They work perfect for me. Really liked it all the way. I do most trad climb around 100 meters and usualy I have to remove the shoes while belaying, but it was expected and with the velcro they are easy to get back on the feet. For me it's precise enough with very suportable disconfort, but I bought have a number down - I can even say it goes better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto MELO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: like the shoes - 3rd pair over the past couple of years. They stretch a little but feel comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: George P. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: If you're buying anasazi's, you already know what you're getting.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the flashiest shoe, and it is definitely not what you want for steep, overhung routes. But for vertical, technical climbs, this shoe is one of the best out there. Great edging, great support, super sticky and durable rubber. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Love. Love
customer_reviews.text: Love. Love. Love. I've only worn this brand and style since I started climbing 9 years ago. Loyalty for life.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is perfect!!......
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly I was worried because they are not leather.. but that is no issue love love this shoe I have the slipper version also.. I do more bouldering than trad or sport climbing ..but this shoe can get almost any job done !!!!
customer_reviews.author: kyle mcdermott

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret these
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to shoes. They are the most comfortable (non lace) climbing shoes I've used. They are versatile and extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob T.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe with a great fit and grab.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as my first climbing shoe and they have been great. Fit was just snug enough to make sure my foot doesn't move while climbing but not super uncomfortable to be unbearable. Climbing shoes are really made for long periods of time of use but I expect they will stretch out a bit and get a little more comfortable. Great toe and heel rubber, very sturdy. The price was great too. I really didn't care what color I got, just wanted the Anasazi's and why pay a ton more just because of the color. Overall, highly suggested.
customer_reviews.author: FFJohn

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: Born in five tens and going to die in them. Great shoes I had several laced five tens and tried these Velcro and it's faster to put on and off in between crags. I'm a size 8 street and 7/7.5 in rock shoes. I got size 7 (thinking of they were way to small Amazon prime return them for a bigger shoe) and it fit as I expected them too. Tight in the toe box and toes start to hurt after 40 mins in them brand new. As I climb they've stretched a bit and less hurtful. So over all they stretch a bit especially after a few resoles
customer_reviews.author: @Rock_etbro

customer_reviews.title: Powerful combo of edging, smearing, and stability
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are close to the best on the market for edging, but still good at smearing and stiff enough for mildly steep routes. Particularly if you're climbing in California or another place with a lot of granite and sandstone, these are as good as it gets in almost every way. Sizing is a bit tricky. They don't stretch and you really need to get the fit just right. A non-painful fit runs about a 1/2 to 1 size larger than my street shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: As good as usual for 5.10 shoes - which means they are the best (for me at least). About half a size larger than expected. I usually get 1 size smaller climbing shoes compared to street shoes - for these I should have chosen 1.5 smaller. Otherwise nice - perfect format for my foot. Good rubber. Good all-round climbing shoes. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Doru C

customer_reviews.title: Small but Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for slab , very sticky, I got a size 11 and they feel smaller than a 9.5 solution. Really great shoe, can wear them for a little over an hour at a time since they've been broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Best sport climbing shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for more than 2 years now. Best sport climbing shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Ajay K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. After the first day of climbing, my favorite shoes for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Milos Skalsky

customer_reviews.title: The heel fits amazing though, and the rubber is very very sticky
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 street shoe. I checked the size chart on the company website and measured out to an exact 10.5. Way way too small. I went a full size up to an 11.5, and they are barely too small, but I suspect will stretch a bit. I would go at least a full size up if you want these. The straps are also almost a little too long. The heel fits amazing though, and the rubber is very very sticky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit 2 Sizes Up
customer_reviews.text: We had the good fortune to try on a pair from a very helpful person at Gainesville Rock Gym so we already knew to order 2 sizes larger and the fit was perfect. The shoes are great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dale Roznowski

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, I returned them since I didn't like the color.
customer_reviews.author: Vency L

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They still hurt.. but my feet are huge and I'm a bit of a wimp.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Gave up....
customer_reviews.text: After returning 3 times I gave up and bought them locally. Literally 4 times larger than what size I actually use, and YES I knew I needed a larger size than what I normally where. Shoes themselves are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: David Hassellhoff

customer_reviews.title: better than a poke in the eye with a blunt stick
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe now have one pair 10.5 that I can wear all day and pair of 9.5's for those climbs
customer_reviews.author: Dane C Sutton

customer_reviews.title: bad sizing
customer_reviews.text: Well Idk what else to try- Ive Tried Every size with Five Ten and NOTHING FITS- I wear size 13 street shoe- and have allways climbed in 12.5s. but in 5.10 size 12.5,13,and 13.5 have all been MURDEROUS small- and when I tried size 14- it jumps about 3 inches-- Absolutly a waste if you have big feet- This is my 4th return- and will no longer buy Five Tens -looks like its back to evolvs- and la sportivas. Bummer too- as 5-10 makes what seems like good shoes.......
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: These shoes run way to small for their size. ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run way to small for their size. Ended up buying LaSportiva Mythos in same size which are much larger.
customer_reviews.author: Tuddy

customer_reviews.title: Heel is Good!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of the heel on this shoe, but after 4 months it has really held up. I heel hook CONSTANTLY! They aren't overly aggressive, but are very comfortable (as far as climbing shoes go). They are a good intermediate-to-advanced shoe. Great for the wide-footed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are 1.5 inches smaller than listed.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are absolutely great in terms of durability, grip, and edging, but be sure to check the sizing chart before buying online. The heel-to-toe measurement runs about 1 to 1.5 inches shorter than the US sizing. I wear size 13 sneakers but won't fit anything smaller than a 15 in the Anasazi's.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hodge

product_meta.title: Five Ten Men's Anasazi VCS Rock Climbing Shoes
product_meta.description: Five Ten, the Brand of the Brave, is a leader in performance, high-friction footwear. From downhill mountain bike racing to rock climbing, from wing suit flying to kayaking, Five Ten makes footwear for the world's most dangerous sports. The Redlands, California-based company has been producing cutting-edge designs and proprietary Stealth rubber soles for nearly 30 years. With the help of top national and international athletes and guides, combined with a world-class rubber-testing and R&D facility, Five Ten is the shoe brand of choice for the world's most exciting athletes.
feature_bullets: Lined synthetic Cowdura upper - No stretch
